sentences.sContent: one of my more able students
sentences.sCn: 我班上能力比较强的学生之一

sentences.sContent: ...you should be able to signal to them...
...Successful team leaders know exactly where the team should go and are able to take prompt action...
...When you can quote a specific number like a fifth of the patients were able to quit...
...you wouldn’t expect to turn up and just be able to run it...
...so I was able to say to myself...
...A very small number of people are able to remember almost every detail of their life...
...Dutt says they were not able to evaluate the actual scientific qualifications of the applicants using the data in the files...
...Women want to be able to do it all volunteer for school parties or cook delicious meals，and so their answer to any request is often Yes...
...Leaders have to be able to delegate and manage resources wisely – including staff expertise...
...It is also more accurate — the rats are able to find more TB infections and...

synos.tran: 能；[经管]有能力的；能干的

phrases.pCn: 经受得住某事(指困难、痛苦的事)
能人；有能力的人；有用的人才
一级水手；熟练水手；[英国，加拿大]二等水兵

words.tran: 体能歧视（由于对体能或智能较差的人不去作特别照顾所构成的歧视）

trans.tranOther: clever or good at doing something
